conclusion: A drives towards the block group from the lower left.
The straight line that joins A’s starting point with the main group first meets the orange barrier.
A hits the two-block orange stack that is furthest to the left; because those two cubes are light they topple and A keeps moving but with much less speed.
The car runs into the big solid orange cube that sits just behind the toppled stack.
This cube is heavier, so most of the car’s remaining kinetic energy is absorbed here.
The contact surface is almost square to the car’s direction, so very little sideways deflection is produced.
The car merely pushes a few centimetres more and stops.
It never reaches the yellow, blue/green or red blocks.
Blocks actually struck: the two small orange cubes in the left-hand orange stack and the large single orange cube directly behind them.

Final rest position of A: right up against the large orange cube, inside the orange cluster, with its nose touching that cube and its tail still pointing roughly toward the lower left corner of the scene.
